node.statement:
ADMITTED RESULTS. Two external results are admitted without proof:

(A) MSS REAL-ROOTEDNESS PRESERVATION (node 1.2, ADMITTED): If p, q in P_n, then r = p boxplus_n q in P_n. This is Marcus-Spielman-Srivastava [MSS15, Theorem 4.4]. Uses the method of interlacing families. Standard in the literature and widely accepted.

(B) MSS DERIVATIVE IDENTITY (node 1.3, ADMITTED): (p boxplus_n q) prime(x) = n * (p^{(1)} boxplus_{n-1} q^{(1)})(x), where p^{(1)} = (1/n)p prime. This is [MSS15, Proposition 4.5]. Direct computation from the coefficient formula.

IMPACT ASSESSMENT: Result (A) is used to ensure r has n simple real roots. Result (B) is not directly used in the current proof path but could enable an inductive approach. Neither admitted result causes the main gap.
